C2 a feeling of unhappiness and disappointment: be filled with dismay Aid workers were said to have been filled with dismay by the appalling conditions that the refugees were living in.in/with dismay The fans watched in/with dismay as their team lost 42–11.to someone's dismay She discovered, to her dismay, that her exam was a whole month earlier than she'd expected.
